children.subject:
16A + research internship seems manageable... 6 hours research, another 2 hours of EE16A lecture/discussion and another 2-4 hours of learning the material/doing hw. When midterms come, you can rearrange your schedule to what fits best since its your own project :)

The research might even supplement your 16A experience, or both experiences could supplement each other if there's some overlap :)

history.content:
Hi, I was wondering if people think it would be feasible for me to take EECS 16A this summer while also doing a research internship in which I'm doing my own project. I would plan on dedicating about 6 hours/week day to research. I'm an l&S cs major and I've taken 61A/B and 70 with Sahai but have no linear algebra experience. My only experience with circuits was AP Physics 1 back in high school. Since there's a month until the session starts I'm also willing to start self-studying the notes and old HWs.

I really want to take at least one class over the summer, so if not 16A would 54 be a better option? Thanks!
history.subject: 16A summer and research internship
